intro: Korthalsella taenioides f. pendula, commonly known as the hanging korthalsella, is a unique and rare plant species belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its pendulous growth habit, with long, slender stems that droop downward, creating an elegant, cascading appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom in clusters along the stems. Native to specific regions in South Africa, it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid environment. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in specialized gardens and botanical collections.
